table.title: Rule actions for enabling Rx CDR
Applicability of Rx CDR tags for various events

row.entry: CDR event type. Syntax comprises of application type_request.
The identifier assigned to the session at establishment.

entry.p: This tag takes the value from the AF-Application-identifier AVP (AVP code 504), is of type OctetString, and it contains information that identifies the particular service that the AF service session belongs to. This information may be used by the PCRF to differentiate QoS for different application services.

For example, the AF-Application-Identifier may be used as additional information together with the Media-Type AVP when the QoS class for the bearer authorization at the Gx interface is selected. The AF-Application-Identifier may be used also to complete the QoS authorization with application-specific default settings in the PCRF if the AF does not provide full Session-Component-Description information.

row.entry: This tag takes the value from the AF-Charging-Identifier AVP (AVP code 505), is of type OctetString, contains the AF Charging Identifier that is sent by the AF. This information may be used for charging correlation with bearer layer.
This tag takes the value from the Service-URN AVP (AVP code 525), is of type OctetString, and it indicates that an AF session is used for emergency traffic.
The IPv4 address for the device associated with the session.
The framed IPv6 address. Any session command with an IPV6 prefix has this available.
The list of all the af media component types, separated by the sub-field separator.
The list of all the af media component types, separated by the sub-field separator.
The list of all the af media component types, separated by the sub-field separator.
The Media component number, dumped for of AAR and AAA only.
The status of the Media component flow. It is dumped for of AAR and AAA only.
The current timestamp in local time.

entry.p: This tag takes the value from Service-Info-Status AVP (AVP code 527), is of type Enumerated, and indicates the status of the service information that the AF is providing to the PCRF. If the Service-Info-Status AVP is not provided in the AA request, the value FINAL SERVICE INFORMATION is assumed.
FINAL SERVICE INFORMATION (0): This value is used to indicate that the service has been fully negotiated between the two ends and service information provided is the result of that negotiation.

PRELIMINARY SERVICE INFORMATION (1): This value is used to indicate that the service information, provided by the AF to the PCRF, is preliminary and needs to be further negotiated between the two ends (for example, for IMS when the service information is sent based on the SDP offer).

row.entry: This tag takes the value from the RR-Bandwidth AVP.
This tag takes the value from the RS-Bandwidth AVP.
Identifies the endpoint that originated the message. This value is unique within a single host.
The IMEI associated with the session for which the CDR is being generated.
Contains the identity of the mobile subscriber.
Contains the E164 identity of the subscriber.
The abort cause received in the ASR messages.
The abort cause sent in the Rx RAR Messages.
The specific action sent in the Rx RAR message.
The session termination cause received in the STR messages.
